Determine the phagocytic ability of microglial cells, we prefer to use apoptotic neural cells as targets, since they should most closely approximate natural microglial targets in vivo.

1. Dissociate neural progenitor cells in 0.1M PBS + 2mg/ml papain \(Worthington) at 37º C for 30 m.
  2.
Treat dissociated neural progenitor cells \(NPC) with UV light for 15-20 minutes; NOTE:
this should be done in a thin plastic petri dish; thick plastic \(eg.

Wash NPC in 50 ml conical tube with 40 ml PBS \(RT),
Spin at 1200 RPM, 7 m, RT, low brake.

Suspend NPC in 5 ml RT 0.1M PBS
  5.
Add 5 ul sta 5\(6)-TAMRA, SE \(Invitrogen) to NPC,

Incubate at 37º C in dark for 15 m.

Wash 3X  \(as in Step 3) with 40 ml ice-cold 0.1M PBS.

Cover slips in 24-well plates) in 900 ul DMEM/F12 + 10% fetal bovine serum \(Atlanta Biologicals) +
Anti-anti at a ratio of 10 NPC:1 microglial cell.
